summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/03/27 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Klim Shipenko']} Review Text: I only watch documentary type movies. While this one might take some liberties, the movie was very well presented. Just the right amount of tension and drama without being over the top. It also gives an interesting glimpse into US/Soviet relations at the time. While some feel the movie has "propaganda", it just seemed to me to be a reflection of Russian attitudes towards the US. (Like if we thought this thing was dangerous why would we haul it into the Shuttle and bring it back. Also since we HAD the Shuttle what technological secrets would we learn by stealing an old space station). The very end of the movie (by the credits) has a brief moment of typical old school Soviet political bluster but now it really is kitschy and kind of funny. Review Title: Nicely done. Excellent cinematography Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/10/06 Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Patrick Heaphy'], 'Producers': ['Patrick Heaphy', 'Lennon Nersesian'], 'Starring': ['Various', 'Persons on'], 'Studio': ['Hudson Valley Pictures']} Review Text: There's a few minutes worth of actual info here - the rest is just intrusively filming people on the day it happened after the towers fall. As others have mentioned it seems disrespectful to film people's reactions esp since many turn away or put their hand up to block the camera. Very different vibe from filming crowd reactions to JFK. It is historical however but since the cameraman was so far from the towers there's really no unique footage. I didn't finish watching it and only watched as much as I did because I was busy and didn't turn it off. The only thing the video brings back was how many rumors were going around the whole country. An important aspect those very young at the time or born after 9-11 may not appreciate. Review Title: 10 min worth of info Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/12/12 Average Rating: 3.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Liam Dale'], 'Producers': ['Sue Hosler'], 'Starring': ['Liam Dale'], 'Studio': ['Total Content Digital']} Review Text: This IS incredibly boring - and I watch many non-fiction or historical documentary type programs. And even more so the "documentary" is just one guy reading a script often with just pictures in the background. So really it's more like story time.

The second issue is if you know anything about British or medieval European history you're likely to be puzzled by the randomness and inconsistent detailing of the scandals. William the Conqueror gets a minute (maybe) but just droning on about other things. Along with no mention of some well known historical tidbits. So not sure why this was even made. It's scope is too large for the time allotted so it just skips over a great deal. Review Title: Boring, story time narration Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Cartoon Rarities of the 1920s and 30s Review Date: 2020/12/30 Store: Various (Actor), Max Fleischer;Ub Iwerks;Tex Avery;Walter Lantz (Director) Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Independently Distributed, Comedy Product Description: ['28 amazing cartoons from the Golden Age of Animation! Rare classics from masters like Max Fleischer, Tex Avery, Walter Lantz, and Ub Iwerks.'] Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 5.12 Ounces', 'Director': 'Max Fleischer;Ub Iwerks;Tex Avery;Walter Lantz', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Run time': '3 hours and 7 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 8, 2017', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Studio': 'Alpha Video', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: Bought this as a gift for someone who is discovering vintage cartoons and tv. (They are actually voluntarily watching Whose the Boss reruns). Well for the 5 min I was in the room while this was on I actually got the remote and turned it off just listening to the annoying music play over and over. I'm surprised TV even got off the ground if this was all they had to watch. Thankfully my gen had better cartoons and I didn't have to watch this stuff. Why anyone would want to is a mystery. Review Title: Yikes Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2022/01/15 Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tim Wolochatiuk'], 'Producers': ['Andre Barro', 'Greg Lanning', 'Bernard Vaillot'], 'Starring': ['Rick Roberts', 'Quentin Krog', 'Brendan Murray'], 'Studio': ['XiveTV']} Review Text: I think people expect way too much from this. The seeds of Jonestown occurred over years, involved many people who all had (and still have) their own stories and can be observed from many different angles. This is a story from the aspect of several different survivors - including the son of Jones, an estranged parent of a member, a reporter and a member trying to escape. It covers the days immediately before the end. I also find it odd commenters judging survivors stories like it is supposed to be for their entertainment. If you are looking for the complete history of Jonestown this is not remotely it. If you are looking for theories or discussions about the bigger picture o Review Title: A facet of a larger picture Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The purchase history indicates a strong preference for documentary-style films, especially those that explore historical events and societal issues. The individual rates high-quality cinematography and thoughtful narrative structures highly, as evidenced by their positive ratings for well-crafted documentaries. However, they are critical of superficial or poorly executed content, expressing disappointment when documentaries fail to provide substantial information or engage with the subject matter meaningfully, as shown by lower ratings for lackluster projects.

A notable focus on socio-political themes, particularly those relating to US/Soviet relations and historical tragedies, suggests an interest in understanding complex narratives. There is a sensitivity towards authenticity and respect in storytelling, indicating that the individual values genuine, multifaceted perspectives over sensationalism.

Quality appears to be prioritized over price, as ratings remain high for well-produced content despite varying price points. This user does not shy away from critical evaluations, often highlighting production quality and narrative coherence. Overall, the core preferences revolve around high-quality, in-depth explorations of historical subjects, with a keen eye for respectful representation and a disdain for poorly executed narratives.

target_interaction.title: No walking 😹😹
target_interaction.text:
Like other negative reviews said this is junk. I bought this as a gift for a younger person with ASD who doesn't drive. They really liked her walking video. In that video she is very friendly and upbeat which is helpful for those who can be intimidated or discourage easily.

So this was a major disappointment. It really is a long commercial in the beginning which is silly because you already bought the dvd. Then there is little to no walking - it's an aerobics class with too many fast paced complicated moves. The person I bought it for stopped after a few minutes. And the generic annoying "music" in the background doesn't help any. It seems she had some good videos and then just made these junk videos where she even sounds stressed like she's just going thru the motions.
target_interaction.title_meta: Leslie Sansone - Miracle Mile: Walk 1 Mile [DVD]
target_interaction.store: Leslie Sansone  (Actor)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
